com.layar.sdk

Class LayarSDKFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.layar.sdk.LayarSDKFragment

  • public final class LayarSDKFragment
extends Fragment
    Fragment that can be used to embed the Layar experience in your own Activities.

      • openLayer

        public void openLayer(Uri uri)
        Open a specific layer by providing a URI. This URI can be of the following format: http://m.layar.com/open/[layername] layar://[layername] Any custom parameters added to the URI will be passed along in the server request for your layer.
        Parameters:
        uri -

      • openFilters

        public void openFilters()
        Open the filter settings screen. Note: this is only functional when a geo layer is loaded.

      • switchViewMode

        public void switchViewMode(LayarSDKFragment.ViewMode mode)
        Switch to the desired ViewMode (AR or Map). Map view is only available for geo layers and available when the host application includes the Google Play Services and provides a valid maps API key in its manifest.
        Parameters:
        mode -

      • setDefaultPopOutUIEnabled

        public void setDefaultPopOutUIEnabled(boolean defaultPopOutUIEnabled)
        Specify whether the default Pop-out UI should be enabled. If set to false you can still trigger Pop-out mode using the API calls.
        Parameters:
        defaultPopOutUIEnabled - (true by default)

      • setPopOutShowPreviewImage

        Parameters:
        showPreviewImage - (true by default)

      • setPopOutTrackingEnabled

        public void setPopOutTrackingEnabled(boolean trackingEnabled)
        Specify whether tracking needs to stay enabled while in pop-out mode. This can be used to implement automatic re-attachment of the content.
        Parameters:
        trackingEnabled - (false by default)

      • setPopOutFitContent

        public void setPopOutFitContent(boolean popOutFitContent)
        Specify whether the content on the page should be fitted to the screen in pop-out mode. If set to true, the pop-out view will dynamically adjust to fit the entire bounding box of the (3D) content. If set to false, only the reference image is fitted to the screen. For static content, it is advised to set this to true. When you have animated content (e.g. content thats animated away from view) you should set it to false to prevent the pop-out view from showing the content you wanted to hide.
        Parameters:
        popOutFitContent - (true by default)

      • setPopOut3DModeEnabled

        public void setPopOut3DModeEnabled(boolean enable3D)
        Specify whether 3D mode is enabled in the pop-out mode. This allows the user to use gestures to tilt and rotate the content. If not set specifically, it will be disabled for 2D content and enabled when there is 3D content (either 3D models or 2D objects placed at a different Z height). Note: when setPopOutFitContent is set to false, 3D mode is not automatically enabled. If needed, enable it explicitly.
        Parameters:
        enable3D -

      • setPopOut3DTiltEnabled

        public void setPopOut3DTiltEnabled(boolean enableTilt)
        Specify whether 3D content should be tilted in pop-out mode. Note: this only affects the view for automatic
        Parameters:
        enableTilt - (true by default)
